reviews.text: I had stayed at this Super 8 a number of times over the years and been very satisfied. This time the nearby construction almost made me by pass the area. I'm glad I didn't. The motel had just finished renovating the rooms. Everything was spanky clean. The clerk was polite and helpful. All equipment worked properly. The bed was comfortable. The indoor pool looked inviting. The breakfast was basic but included cereals, mini-muffins, and mini-sweet rolls. (I was spoiled by the fresh waffles served at Michigan Super 8's.) A family on a budget could enjoy a weekend here. As a traveler, I was very pleased.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay for the Budget Traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found this to be an older hotel but still in reasonable shape, and pretty clean. Clerk said there would be a hot breakfast but it wasn't there. New management. Close to WalMart - lol! I did use the car wash next door. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Reasonable place

likes.disliked: — wanted to try their hot breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are seniors traveling on a budget. My handicapped wife and I stayed in room #131, a handicapped drive-up, king bed room, on a Wednesday, 23 April, 2008. We booked this room through the Super 8 website for the price of $48.53. The overall appearance of the motel and lobby were fine. A hoped for early check-in was not to be as apparently motel policy is to let no check-in prior to 3:00pm. Check-in went moderately well although the clerk and her trainee were very non-communicative and not very responsive to questions or problems with the room. The room was large but very crowded with a very out-of place overstuffed arm chair and a broken wobbly desk chair. These made it difficult to both sit comfortably and move about the room in what was supposed to be a handicapped room. The room, bathroom and vanity were clean and there were no lingering odors in the room. The bed was comfortable. The shower worked well, water pressure and drainage OK. The room, which had both exterior and interior entry, was semi-quiet and safety precautions were in place. There was a lock on the inside of the bathroom door, something I had never noted in a handicapped room before. Evidence of a pry on this door showed that someone had inadvertently locked themselves in there before. A moderate terrible continental breakfast was offered. The mini-muffins were still frozen and the juice was practically water. Check-out was easy and the billing was accurate. We might, or might not, stay here again but only after giving serious consideration to other motels in the area.
reviews.title: An Average Stay

likes.liked: — Bead comfort; quiet room; close to the Interstate
likes.disliked: — Terrible, terrible breakfast; handicapped room not fuirnished for handicapped people

reviews.text: We stayed at the Super 8 in Grants, NM on our cross country drive. We had been driving for over 13 hours that day going through the Petrified Forest National Park and Canyon de Chelly in Arizona. The Super 8 was right off the interstate. The front desk was friendly and we had a smooth check-in. The room was clean and everything worked properly. The bathroom (toilet and tub) was very small. The sink was on the outside, which is a nice feature in hotels. The continental breakfast was good. The con was the wireless internet. We were only about 6 rooms from the front desk and had no signal in our room! We had to go to the lobby to use the internet on our laptop. Overall a good stay except for the wireless internet.
reviews.title: Decent stay at the Super 8

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were driving from Florida to Vegas and stayed in Grants on the second night of our roadtrip. The guy at the counter was really nice and helpful, the room was clean and I love the indoor pool. You have a Dennys nearby and a few other places to eat. Good stop for a roadtrip!
reviews.title: Good place to stay for a night

likes.liked: — Close to I-40 and free wifi

reviews.title: Don't believe anemnities
reviews.text: Creepy guy working at desk. Can't park in main lot because of resurfacing, so can't keep an eye on my car as the creepy guy suggested. Pool not open, no workout facilities. Kind of afraid to stay the night!!!!!

reviews.title: Value for Money Budget Motel
reviews.text: Good value for money, this place gives you everything you need. A reasonable sized room, small but adequate bed. An indoor pool and hot tub for those who wish to indulge, and a laundry if needed.
This motel was actually the best place we stayed at on an extended vacation throughout New Mexico and Colorado. Big room, nice staff. The only Super 8 that I have ever seen with a pool.
reviews.title: Surprizingly Nice Place

reviews.text: But Grants is an ugly town, and there is absolutely no reason to stop here unless you just need a place to sleep for the night.
reviews.title: Awesome!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed weekend in june!! Desk clerk was awesome!! I highly recommend! Thanx super 8!!!
reviews.title: dont stay here

reviews.text: we thought this motel may be ok but when we got in the room you could see that it needed a thorough clean. the bath was brown and everything just looked old and grubby. when we checked out at about 9am the guy/receptionist attended to me in his pyjamas so that gives you some idea of the standards of this hotel. breakfast was included in the price but was at a cafe next door which we thought may be ok. we had 3 choices and the best of which was one egg, one slice toast and a slice of bacon with coffee. the bacon was about half inch wide, mostly fat and burnt to a crisp! orange juice had to be paid for.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet room in good location at an excellent price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was very clean and quite comfortable. The wi-fi worked perfectly in my upstairs room. There's a gas station next door and several restaurants nearby, and it's right off the freeway which was nice for this tired traveler on a cross-country trip. The price was very reasonable, and I never heard any noise from other guests - slept soundly all night.
reviews.title: Don't know what I expected for the price
